body: no matter who wins, the presidency is never going to be seen as legitimate again.  I remember 2000 and the hanging chads, Americans have been slowly losing faith in their electoral process for a long time, and this is the death knell.  you've got 350 million people running around right now, all of them thinking they're king of a one man empire, none of them capable of accepting any authority but their own

body:
I feel that it's a complete fraud
I'm from south america and I'm really afraid that if Biden wins he's going to fuck our economy even more than it already is somehow, I know nothing about economy but I heard some rumours about that, on top of that, I also don't agree with democrats and I think Trump should be the winner when he's fighting against some old corrupt person who also happens to be "crazy", I still think that there should be at least another actual option for the democrats to vote so at least their voting goes to someone who wouldn't just say "hey, I want to bomb russia and fuck my sister today!" just because of his mental problems (not making fun of it, the guy actually has mental problems, probably).

post.body: The votes should point to a winner soon, though there will be legal challenges and recounts.
post.body_html: The votes should point to a winner soon, though there will be legal challenges and recounts.
post.title: How is everyone feeling about the election so far?

body:
I'm more annoyed by the media. They'd claimed it would be a Biden landslide for weeks, come election day, he's barely in the lead. Barely. Trump may still win this, though it's unlikely, but it's hardly a landslide. Not even close. How can you be so wrong, (for a second time in a row, mind you), and still claim to accurately represent the will of the country? 

The media is just full of complete idiots; out of touch, unaware, living in a country with a people they truly don't understand and don't care to understand. Their thoughts, values, and opinions are not the thoughts, values, and opinions of most Americans, that much is clear, and they need to go. Clean sweep of all the heads of the media, all the so called journalists, the analysts, etc. Replace them all with people who are actually qualified to be there, and from all political branches, not just the left.

Their thoughts, values, and opinions are not the thoughts, values, and opinions of most Americans, that much is clear, and they need to go. Clean sweep of all the heads of the media, all the so called journalists, the analysts, etc. Replace them all with people who are actually qualified to be there, and from all political branches, not just the left.

body:
To a certain extent I’d prefer that; autonomy is important.

Unfortunately it’s not like that. How much autonomy have we seen with mask mandates and forced business closings?

The majority of people are stupid lemmings who parrot a pet authority figure rather than think for themselves, and want their pet authoritative doctrine applied to everyone.

Pluralism is dead. Very few people think “live and let live” anymore, in large part because they’re too stupid to understand how forcing others to adhere to your views, pay your taxes, worship the same virtues, etc inevitably gets used against you and leads to darwinian power struggles.

Most people are atomized and living amongst people with different views rather than communities of like minded individuals under the leadership they’re looking for, and rather than organize into more autonomous little enclaves that adhere to those views, and have those enclaves cooperate via a hierarchy and a representative congress as originally intended, they’re spoiled and lazy and demand everyone around them act as they do.
body_html:
To a certain extent I’d prefer that; autonomy is important.

Unfortunately it’s not like that. How much autonomy have we seen with mask mandates and forced business closings?

The majority of people are stupid lemmings who parrot a pet authority figure rather than think for themselves, and want their pet authoritative doctrine applied to everyone.

Pluralism is dead. Very few people think “live and let live” anymore, in large part because they’re too stupid to understand how forcing others to adhere to your views, pay your taxes, worship the same virtues, etc inevitably gets used against you and leads to darwinian power struggles.

Most people are atomized and living amongst people with different views rather than communities of like minded individuals under the leadership they’re looking for, and rather than organize into more autonomous little enclaves that adhere to those views, and have those enclaves cooperate via a hierarchy and a representative congress as originally intended, they’re spoiled and lazy and demand everyone around them act as they do.

parent.body: no matter who wins, the presidency is never going to be seen as legitimate again.  I remember 2000 and the hanging chads, Americans have been slowly losing faith in their electoral process for a long time, and this is the death knell.  you've got 350 million people running around right now, all of them thinking they're king of a one man empire, none of them capable of accepting any authority but their own

body:
Great.  Looks like Biden won.  We can start to undo the madness of Trump, but it will take a long ass time to repair his devastation.  My biggest concern is that he effectively brainwashed you all to the point where you cause some kind of terrible thing to happen, or that he throws a 2 month temper tantrum as a lame duck.  He could start some kind of fucking war.  This is a bully who just got punched in the mouth and who knows what he will do.  

I'm especially happy democracy prevailed here.  He clearly pushed for a dictatorship, but only the first couple steps of his plan worked.
body_html:
Great. Looks like Biden won. We can start to undo the madness of Trump, but it will take a long ass time to repair his devastation. My biggest concern is that he effectively brainwashed you all to the point where you cause some kind of terrible thing to happen, or that he throws a 2 month temper tantrum as a lame duck. He could start some kind of fucking war. This is a bully who just got punched in the mouth and who knows what he will do.

I'm especially happy democracy prevailed here. He clearly pushed for a dictatorship, but only the first couple steps of his plan worked.

body:
Agreed, that level of plurality must still accept a loose, higher level, shared cooperative framework (like christian and enlightenment values) and requires a certain level of intelligent actors distributed amongst each enclave in order to function.

We are spoiled, lazy, stupid, and have no such loose framework in which a pluralistic society could work anymore, and trying to get a population like that to cooperate without a strongman/dollar hoarder forcing it is mostly hopeless.
body_html:

body:
> I know nothing about economy but I heard some rumours

That's not reassuring.

> the guy actually has mental problems, probably

If you're not a psychologist or psychiatrist who has examined Biden, I'd not be so certain. 

I'm directing this at you, but it applies to a lot of other people; going off of rumors and unsubstantiated claims is dangerous.

I feel that it's a complete fraud
I'm from south america and I'm really afraid that if Biden wins he's going to fuck our economy even more than it already is somehow, I know nothing about economy but I heard some rumours about that, on top of that, I also don't agree with democrats and I think Trump should be the winner when he's fighting against some old corrupt person who also happens to be "crazy", I still think that there should be at least another actual option for the democrats to vote so at least their voting goes to someone who wouldn't just say "hey, I want to bomb russia and fuck my sister today!" just because of his mental problems (not making fun of it, the guy actually has mental problems, probably).
